competitorAnalysis.action: Review top-ranking competitors to identify optimization opportunities and content gaps

missingTitle.issue: Missing title tag - Critical SEO element
missingTitle.action: Add a compelling title tag (50-60 characters) that includes your target keyword near the beginning. Example: "{keyword} - Your Unique Value Proposition | Brand"

titleNotOptimal.action: Adjust your title to 50-60 characters. Current title may be truncated in search results, reducing click-through rate. Keep your main keyword within the first 60 characters.

titleTooShort.action: Expand your title to 50-60 characters. Include your primary keyword, a benefit, and your brand name. Short titles miss ranking opportunities.

missingDescription.issue: Missing meta description - Major SEO gap
missingDescription.action: Add a compelling meta description (150-160 characters) with your target keyword, a clear value proposition, and a call-to-action. This directly impacts click-through rates.

descriptionNotOptimal.action: Adjust to 150-160 characters. Include your primary keyword naturally, highlight unique benefits, and end with a compelling CTA like 'Learn more' or 'Get started today'.

missingH1.issue: Missing H1 tag - Major structural issue
missingH1.action: Add exactly one H1 tag that clearly describes the page content and includes your target keyword. The H1 should be unique and different from your title tag.

multipleH1.action: Use only one H1 tag per page. Convert extra H1s to H2s. Multiple H1s confuse search engines about your page's main topic and dilute keyword relevance.

missingH2.action: Add 3-6 H2 subheadings to structure your content. Include keyword variations and related terms in H2s. This improves readability and helps search engines understand content hierarchy.

fewH2.issue: Only {count} H2 subheading(s) - Content structure weak
fewH2.action: Add more H2 subheadings (aim for 1 per 300 words). Use them to break content into scannable sections. Include LSI keywords and questions users might ask.

imagesNoAlt.action: Add descriptive alt text to all images. Include your keyword naturally where relevant. Good alt text: 'Professional plumber fixing kitchen sink in Boston home' instead of 'plumber' or 'image1'.

tooManyImages.action: Optimize images: compress using WebP format, implement lazy loading, specify width/height attributes, and use responsive images. Aim for total image size under 1MB.

brokenLinks.issue: {count} broken links detected - Hurts user experience and SEO
brokenLinks.action: Fix or remove all broken links immediately. Broken links signal poor maintenance to search engines and frustrate users. Use 301 redirects where appropriate.

fewInternalLinks.issue: Only {count} internal links - Poor site structure
fewInternalLinks.action: Add 3-5 relevant internal links to important pages. Use descriptive anchor text with keywords. Internal linking distributes page authority and helps users navigate.

noExternalLinks.issue: No external links to authoritative sources
noExternalLinks.action: Add 2-3 links to authoritative, relevant external sources. This builds trust and provides value to readers. Ensure links open in new tabs and use rel='noopener'.

missingCanonical.issue: Missing canonical tag - Risk of duplicate content issues
missingCanonical.action: Add a self-referencing canonical tag to prevent duplicate content issues. Format: <link rel='canonical' href='https://yoursite.com/this-page' />

lowWordCount.issue: Content is only {count} words - Below competitive average
lowWordCount.action: Expand content to at least {recommended} words. Top-ranking pages average {competitorAvg} words. Add: detailed explanations, FAQs, examples, case studies, and related subtopics.

veryLowWordCount.action: Pages under 300 words rarely rank well. Create comprehensive content covering: what, why, how, FAQs, examples, and expert tips. Aim for 1,500+ words for competitive keywords.

keywordNotInTitle.issue: Target keyword "{keyword}" not in title tag
keywordNotInTitle.action: Include your primary keyword near the beginning of your title. Example: "{keyword}: [Your Unique Angle] | Brand Name". This is crucial for ranking.

keywordNotInDescription.issue: Target keyword "{keyword}" not in meta description
keywordNotInDescription.action: Include "{keyword}" naturally in your meta description. Google often bolds matching keywords, increasing visibility and click-through rates.

keywordNotInH1.issue: Target keyword "{keyword}" not in H1 heading
keywordNotInH1.action: Include "{keyword}" in your H1 tag. This confirms the page's topic to search engines. Make it natural and compelling for readers.

keywordNotInContent.issue: Target keyword "{keyword}" not found in body content
keywordNotInContent.action: Add "{keyword}" naturally throughout your content. Include it in: first paragraph, at least one subheading, and conclusion. Avoid forced placement.

keywordNotInFirst100Words.action: Include your target keyword in the first 100 words (ideally first paragraph). This signals relevance to search engines and immediately shows users they're in the right place.

keywordNotInUrl.action: If possible, include your keyword in the URL slug. Example: /your-keyword-guide instead of /page123. Keep URLs short, readable, and keyword-relevant.

keywordDensityLow.action: Current: {occurrences} occurrences in {wordCount} words. Add {recommended} more natural mentions of "{keyword}". Use variations and synonyms to avoid repetition.

keywordDensityHigh.issue: Keyword density is {density}% - Risk of over-optimization
keywordDensityHigh.action: Reduce usage of "{keyword}" from {occurrences} to approximately {recommended} times. Replace some instances with synonyms, related terms, or pronouns.

keywordDensityOptimal.action: Maintain current keyword usage. Focus on adding LSI (related) keywords and synonyms to strengthen topical relevance without over-optimization.

missingSchema.action: Add JSON-LD schema markup to qualify for rich snippets. Recommended types: Article, LocalBusiness, Product, FAQ, HowTo, or BreadcrumbList based on your page type.

missingOpenGraph.issue: Missing Open Graph tags for social sharing
missingOpenGraph.action: Add og:title, og:description, og:image, and og:url tags. This controls how your page appears when shared on Facebook, LinkedIn, and other platforms.

missingTwitterCards.action: Add twitter:card, twitter:title, twitter:description, and twitter:image for optimized Twitter sharing. Use 'summary_large_image' for better visibility.

slowLoadTime.issue: Page load time is {time}s (should be under 3s)
slowLoadTime.action: Improve page speed: compress images, enable browser caching, minify CSS/JS, use a CDN, defer non-critical JavaScript, and consider lazy loading.

noHttps.action: HTTPS is a ranking factor. Install an SSL certificate and redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS. This also builds user trust and is required for modern browser features.

missingViewport.issue: Missing viewport meta tag - Mobile issues likely
missingViewport.action: Add <meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1'> for proper mobile rendering. Google uses mobile-first indexing.

noRobotsMeta.action: Add <meta name='robots' content='index, follow'> to explicitly tell search engines to index this page and follow its links.

contentBelowCompetitors.issue: Content is {percent}% shorter than top competitors
contentBelowCompetitors.action: Top 10 results average {avgWords} words. Expand your content to match or exceed this. Add sections covering: common questions, detailed how-tos, case studies, and expert insights.

noLsiKeywords.issue: Limited use of related keywords and synonyms
noLsiKeywords.action: Add LSI keywords and semantic variations. For "{keyword}", consider adding: {suggestions}. This signals comprehensive topical coverage to search engines.

duplicateTitle.issue: Title may be duplicated across your site
duplicateTitle.action: Ensure each page has a unique title tag. Duplicate titles confuse search engines and dilute ranking potential. Include page-specific information in each title.

duplicateDescription.action: Write unique meta descriptions for each page. Duplicate descriptions are a missed opportunity to target page-specific keywords and attract relevant clicks.

strongBoldUsage.issue: No <strong> or <b> tags used for emphasis
strongBoldUsage.action: Use <strong> tags to emphasize 2-3 important phrases including your keyword. This provides visual hierarchy and may help search engines identify key concepts.

missingBreadcrumbs.action: Add breadcrumb navigation and BreadcrumbList schema. This improves user navigation, internal linking, and can show in search results for better CTR.

excellentOptimization.action: Maintain your strong optimization. Focus on: building quality backlinks, updating content regularly, improving Core Web Vitals, and monitoring competitor changes.

nap.notFoundInLocalPack: Business information not found in local pack

citations.notFoundInLocalPack: Business not found in local pack
citations.competitorsHaveWebsite: Competitors have websites listed, but yours is missing
citations.competitorsHaveCategory: Competitors have categories listed, but yours is missing

lowVisibility.issue: Local visibility score is {score}% - Below competitive threshold
lowVisibility.action: Comprehensive local SEO required: optimize Google Business Profile, build 50+ citations on directories (Yelp, Yellow Pages, industry-specific sites), generate 20+ reviews, and create locally-targeted content.

notInLocalPack.issue: Business not appearing in local pack - Missing significant local traffic
notInLocalPack.action: Priority actions: 1) Verify Google Business Profile ownership, 2) Ensure NAP consistency across all platforms, 3) Build citations on 30+ local directories, 4) Generate 10+ reviews in next 30 days, 5) Add locally-relevant content to your website.

lowPosition.issue: Ranked #{position} in local pack - Top 3 get 70% of clicks
lowPosition.action: To reach top 3: Increase review count (aim for 50+), respond to all reviews within 24 hours, add posts weekly, upload new photos monthly, and build more local backlinks.

position1.issue: Currently ranked #1 in local pack - Maintain this position
position1.action: Protect your ranking: Continue generating fresh reviews, post updates weekly, monitor and respond to all reviews, keep business info updated, and track competitor changes.

position2or3.action: To reach #1: Increase review velocity (aim for 5+ new reviews monthly), improve response time to reviews, add weekly GBP posts, and build 10+ new local citations.

noReviews.issue: Zero reviews - Critical for local ranking
noReviews.action: Launch review campaign immediately: Email past customers, add review links to receipts/invoices, create QR codes for in-store requests, and follow up 3-5 days after service completion.

fewReviews.issue: Only {count} reviews vs competitor average of {avg}
fewReviews.action: Build review base: Set goal of {target} reviews in 60 days. Implement: automated review requests, staff training on asking for reviews, and incentive program for staff (not customers).

lowRating.issue: Rating is {rating}/5 - Below the 4.0 threshold for trust
lowRating.action: Rating recovery plan: 1) Respond professionally to all negative reviews, 2) Identify and fix service issues, 3) Proactively ask happy customers to review, 4) Consider offering service recovery to unhappy customers.

goodRating.issue: Rating is {rating}/5 - Good, but room for improvement
goodRating.action: Push toward 4.8+: Thank all positive reviewers, address any recurring concerns mentioned in reviews, and continue delivering excellent service. Higher ratings = higher rankings.

excellentRating.issue: Excellent rating of {rating}/5 - Maintain this standard
excellentRating.action: Maintain excellence: Continue your great service, respond to all reviews, and use positive feedback in marketing. Consider featuring testimonials on your website.

competitorsBetterRating.action: Close the rating gap: Analyze competitor reviews for service insights, identify your weaknesses, train staff on customer experience, and implement a proactive review request system.

competitorsMoreReviews.action: Review generation strategy: Aim for {target} new reviews in 90 days. Use automated follow-ups, SMS review requests, and in-person asks. Top local businesses get 10+ new reviews monthly.

missingPhone.issue: No phone number displayed - Lost call conversions
missingPhone.action: Add a local phone number (same area code as your address). Local numbers build trust and improve rankings. Use a tracking number if needed but ensure it's a local format.

missingWebsite.issue: No website linked - Missing conversion opportunities
missingWebsite.action: Add your website URL. This drives traffic, builds authority, and provides a conversion path. Ensure your website has consistent NAP info and location pages.

napInconsistency.action: Audit all business listings and standardize: Use exact same business name, complete address format, and phone number everywhere. Even small variations (St vs Street) can hurt rankings.

missingCategories.issue: Only primary category set - Missing visibility opportunities
missingCategories.action: Add 5-9 relevant secondary categories to your Google Business Profile. This helps you appear for more local searches. Choose categories that accurately describe your services.

noGbpPosts.action: Post weekly updates on Google Business: promotions, events, tips, or news. Posts improve engagement, show activity, and can include calls-to-action. They expire after 7 days.

noPhotos.issue: Limited photos on Google Business Profile
noPhotos.action: Add 10+ high-quality photos: exterior, interior, team, products/services, and work examples. Businesses with 100+ photos get 520% more calls. Upload new photos monthly.

distanceFromSearcher.issue: Distance may be affecting local rankings
distanceFromSearcher.action: For distance-based ranking improvements: Create location-specific pages, build local backlinks, generate reviews mentioning your location, and ensure service area is properly set.

strongCompetition.action: Competitive differentiation needed: Focus on a niche service, target underserved neighborhoods, build partnerships with local businesses, and create unique local content.

citationOpportunity.action: Build citations on: industry directories, local business directories, chamber of commerce, BBB, and niche sites. Aim for 50+ citations with perfectly consistent NAP.

localContentMissing.action: Create local landing pages for each service area, write location-specific blog posts, add local landmarks and references, and embed Google Map on contact page.

reviewResponseNeeded.action: Respond to ALL reviews within 24-48 hours. Thank positive reviewers specifically, address negative feedback professionally, and show you're engaged. Response rate affects rankings.

serviceAreaOptimization.issue: Service area may not be properly configured
serviceAreaOptimization.action: In GBP settings, clearly define your service areas. For service-area businesses, hide your address but specify service regions. This helps you appear in nearby location searches.

noResults.issue: No local pack results found for this keyword and location
noResults.action: Try using a more specific location or a keyword that typically shows local results

highCompetition.issue: High competition: Average competitor rating is {avgRating}/5
highCompetition.action: Focus on maintaining excellent service quality and customer satisfaction to compete effectively

marketOpportunity.issue: Market opportunity: Average competitor rating is {avgRating}/5
marketOpportunity.action: There is room to stand out by providing better service quality than competitors

competitiveMarket.action: Implement an active review generation strategy to build social proof and compete effectively

napIncomplete.issue: {percentage}% of competitors are missing complete NAP information
napIncomplete.action: Ensure your business has complete Name, Address, and Phone information to improve visibility

napComplete.issue: Most competitors have complete NAP information
napComplete.action: Ensure your NAP (Name, Address, Phone) is complete and consistent across all platforms to compete effectively

competitorsHaveWebsite.action: Add your website URL to your Google Business Profile to match competitor standards

missingCategory.issue: Some competitors are missing category information
missingCategory.action: Ensure your business category is properly set in your Google Business Profile

top3CompetitorsHaveWebsite.issue: All top 3 competitors have websites listed ({percentage}% overall) - Website is critical for top rankings
top3CompetitorsHaveWebsite.action: CRITICAL: Add your website URL to Google Business Profile immediately. Then optimize your website: 1) Create location-specific landing pages with local content, 2) Add NAP in footer/header, 3) Include Schema.org LocalBusiness structured data, 4) Add local keywords naturally in content, 5) Ensure mobile-first design. Top 3 rankings require a well-optimized website.

localContentRequired.issue: To rank in top 10, your website needs local content targeting '{keyword}'
localContentRequired.action: Create location-specific content on your website: 1) Add a dedicated page for '{keyword}' with 1000+ words, 2) Include local landmarks, neighborhoods, and area references, 3) Add customer testimonials from local clients, 4) Create blog posts about local events/community involvement, 5) Include location in title tags and meta descriptions. Local content signals relevance to Google.

gbpOptimizationRequired.issue: Google Business Profile optimization is critical for top 10 rankings
gbpOptimizationRequired.action: Complete and optimize your Google Business Profile: 1) Add all business information (hours, attributes, services), 2) Upload 10+ high-quality photos, 3) Write a compelling 750+ character description with local keywords, 4) Post updates weekly, 5) Respond to all reviews within 24 hours, 6) Add Q&A section with common questions. A complete GBP profile significantly improves local rankings.

top3RatingTarget.issue: Top 3 competitors average {avgRating}/5 rating - You need {targetRating}+ to compete
top3RatingTarget.action: To reach top 3, achieve {targetRating}+ rating: 1) Deliver exceptional service consistently, 2) Implement review request system (email, SMS, in-person), 3) Respond to all reviews professionally, 4) Address negative feedback immediately, 5) Train staff on customer service excellence. Top-rated businesses rank higher.

top3ReviewTarget.issue: Top 3 competitors average {targetReviews} reviews - You need {targetReviews}+ reviews to compete
top3ReviewTarget.action: Build {targetReviews}+ reviews to compete: 1) Set up automated review request system, 2) Send follow-up emails 3-5 days after service, 3) Create QR codes linking to review page, 4) Train staff to ask satisfied customers, 5) Offer incentives to staff (not customers) for review generation. Review volume is a major ranking factor.

top3NAPComplete.issue: Top 3 competitors have complete NAP (Name, Address, Phone) - Match this standard
top3NAPComplete.action: Ensure your NAP is complete and identical everywhere: 1) Google Business Profile, 2) Your website footer/header, 3) 30+ local directories (Yelp, Yellow Pages, industry sites), 4) Social media profiles. Use exact same format (spacing, punctuation, abbreviations). NAP consistency is critical for local ranking.

buildLocalCitations.issue: Build {count} local citations to improve local visibility
buildLocalCitations.action: Create listings on {count} local directories: 1) Major platforms (Google, Yelp, Yellow Pages, Bing Places), 2) Industry-specific directories, 3) Local chamber of commerce, 4) Local business associations, 5) Review sites (TripAdvisor, Trustpilot). Ensure NAP consistency across all. Citations build trust and improve rankings.

localSeoElements.issue: Your website needs local SEO elements to rank in top 10
localSeoElements.action: Add local SEO elements to your website: 1) Location-specific landing pages (one per service area), 2) NAP in footer on every page, 3) Schema.org LocalBusiness structured data, 4) Local keywords in title tags and meta descriptions, 5) Customer testimonials with location mentions, 6) Google Maps embed on contact page. These signals help Google understand your local relevance.

freshContentRequired.issue: Regularly updated content signals active business to Google
freshContentRequired.action: Create fresh local content monthly: 1) Blog posts about local events, community involvement, or area-specific topics, 2) Update service pages with local case studies, 3) Add seasonal content relevant to your location, 4) Share local news or partnerships. Fresh content improves rankings and shows Google your business is active.

localBacklinksRequired.issue: Build {count} local backlinks to strengthen local authority
localBacklinksRequired.action: Acquire {count} local backlinks: 1) Partner with local businesses for cross-promotion, 2) Sponsor local events or charities, 3) Get featured in local news/media, 4) Join local business associations, 5) Guest post on local blogs, 6) Get listed in local resource pages. Local backlinks signal authority and improve rankings.

napIssues.missingName: {percentage}% of competitors are missing business names
napIssues.missingPhone: {percentage}% of competitors are missing phone numbers

citationIssues.missingWebsite: {percentage}% of competitors are missing website URLs
citationIssues.competitorsHaveWebsite: Most competitors ({percentage}%) have websites listed - ensure yours is included
citationIssues.missingCategory: {percentage}% of competitors are missing category information
citationIssues.topCompetitorsHaveWebsite: Top competitors have websites - ensure your website is listed to compete effectively
citationIssues.topCompetitorsHaveCategory: Top competitors have categories - ensure your category is properly set

name.action: Add your exact legal business name. Don't add keywords or locations (unless part of legal name) - this violates guidelines and risks suspension. Example: 'Smith Plumbing' not 'Best Plumber in Boston - Smith Plumbing'.

address.issue: Business address not set - Critical for local visibility
address.action: Add your complete street address. Use the exact format: street number, street name, suite/unit, city, state, ZIP. This is required for Google Maps placement and local pack ranking.

phone.issue: Phone number missing - 60% of local searches result in calls
phone.action: Add a local phone number (matching your service area code). Avoid 800 numbers for local businesses. If using a tracking number, ensure it forwards to your main line.

website.issue: No website linked - Missing major conversion opportunity
website.action: Add your website URL. If you don't have one, Google offers a free basic site through GBP. Your website should have consistent NAP info and location-specific content.

category.issue: Primary category not set - Critical ranking factor
category.action: Choose the most specific primary category that describes your main service. This is the most important ranking factor. Be specific: 'Italian Restaurant' beats 'Restaurant'.

additionalCategories.issue: No secondary categories - Missing search visibility
additionalCategories.action: Add 5-9 relevant additional categories for all services you offer. Example for a plumber: Plumber (primary), Water Heater Repair, Drain Cleaning, Emergency Plumber, Bathroom Remodeler.

description.issue: Business description missing - Tell your story
description.action: Write a 750-character description covering: what you do, who you serve, what makes you unique, your service area, and key services. Include keywords naturally but write for humans first.

descriptionTooShort.action: Expand to 500-750 characters. Include: years in business, unique selling points, service area, main services, and any specializations. Don't waste this prime keyword real estate.

hours.issue: Business hours not set - Customers won't know when to visit
hours.action: Add accurate hours for every day. Include special hours for holidays. Consider adding 'More hours' for different services if applicable. Inaccurate hours lead to negative reviews.

photos.issue: No photos uploaded - Listings with photos get 42% more direction requests
photos.action: Upload 25+ high-quality photos: logo, cover, exterior (day/night), interior, team, products/services, and work examples. Update monthly. Use proper categories when uploading.

fewPhotos.action: Upload at least 25 photos across categories. Businesses with 100+ photos get 520% more calls. Include: exterior (3+), interior (3+), team (3+), products/services (10+).

rating.issue: No Google rating yet - Reviews are crucial for ranking
rating.action: Start generating reviews immediately. Create a review link (Settings > Get more reviews), send to recent customers, and implement systematic follow-up after each transaction.

reviewCount.issue: Less than 5 reviews - Below trust threshold
reviewCount.action: Businesses with 10+ reviews get 50% more conversions. Launch review campaign: email past customers, add review link to receipts, and ask satisfied customers directly.

lowReviewCount.issue: Only {count} reviews - Need 50+ to compete effectively
lowReviewCount.action: Accelerate review generation: automate review requests 2-3 days post-service, train staff to request reviews, create QR codes for physical locations, and respond to every review.

attributes.issue: No business attributes selected - Missing valuable information
attributes.action: Add all relevant attributes: accessibility features, payment methods, amenities (WiFi, parking), health & safety, LGBTQ+ friendly, women-owned, etc. This helps you appear in filtered searches.

lowReviews.issue: Only {count} reviews - Competitors likely have more
lowReviews.action: Goal: Generate {target}+ reviews in next 90 days. Strategy: automated follow-ups, in-person requests, SMS review links, and review generation campaigns. Track weekly progress.

lowRating.issue: Rating is {rating}/5 - Below the critical 4.0 threshold
lowRating.action: Recovery needed: 1) Respond to ALL negative reviews professionally, 2) Identify service issues from feedback, 3) Actively request reviews from satisfied customers, 4) Train staff on customer experience.

shortDescription.issue: Description is {length} characters - Use the full 750 allowed
shortDescription.action: Expand your description to include: business history, services offered, service area, unique qualifications, and customer benefits. Use natural keyword placement.

notFound.issue: Business profile not found in search
notFound.action: Claim or create your Google Business Profile: 1) Search for your business on Google, 2) Click 'Claim this business' or create new listing at business.google.com, 3) Complete verification.

missingServices.action: Add all your services with descriptions and prices (if applicable). This helps customers understand offerings and improves visibility for specific service searches.

noPosts.issue: No Google Posts in last 30 days - Profile appears inactive
noPosts.action: Post weekly: offers, events, updates, tips, or news. Posts appear in your listing and search results. Include a photo, 100-300 words, and a call-to-action button.

noQA.issue: Q&A section is empty - Missing engagement opportunity
noQA.action: Seed your Q&A with 5-10 common questions customers ask. This provides helpful info, shows you're active, and can include keywords naturally. Monitor and answer all customer questions quickly.

messagingDisabled.issue: Messaging is turned off - Missing customer inquiries
messagingDisabled.action: Enable messaging in GBP settings. This allows customers to message you directly from your listing. Set up auto-responses and ensure someone monitors daily.

noBookingLink.action: Add a booking link through GBP (Settings > Booking). This allows customers to schedule directly from your profile. Use your own booking system or partner integrations.

verificationNeeded.action: Complete verification ASAP - unverified profiles don't rank. Request postcard verification or phone/email if available. Verification usually takes 5-14 days by mail.

irregularHours.action: Review and update hours for accuracy. Add special hours for holidays, temporary closures, and different service hours. Inaccurate hours lead to frustrated customers and negative reviews.

noMenuOrCatalog.action: For restaurants: add full menu with prices. For retail/services: add product catalog. This appears in your listing and helps customers make decisions.

profileIncomplete.issue: Profile completeness is {score}% - Incomplete profiles rank lower
profileIncomplete.action: Complete profiles rank higher and convert better. Priority: address, phone, hours, categories, description, photos, services, attributes. Aim for 100% completion.

excellentProfile.action: Maintain profile excellence: post weekly, upload new photos monthly, respond to all reviews, answer Q&A promptly, and keep information current. Monitor competitors' profiles.

passwordReset.subject: Reset your password
passwordReset.message: Click the button below to reset your password.

emailVerification.subject: Verify your email
emailVerification.message: Click the button below to verify your email.

welcome.subject: Welcome to Serpixa
welcome.message: Your account is ready. You can now create and manage SEO audits and campaigns.

seoAudit.subject: Your SEO Audit is Ready - {url}
seoAudit.intro: Your SEO audit for {url} has been completed. Here are the key findings:
seoAudit.noIssues: No critical issues found. Great job!
seoAudit.footer: This audit was generated by Serpixa. For questions, contact our support team.

gbpAudit.subject: Your Google Business Profile Audit is Ready - {businessName}
gbpAudit.intro: Your Google Business Profile audit for {businessName} has been completed.
gbpAudit.footer: This audit was generated by Serpixa. For questions, contact our support team.

geoAudit.subject: Your Local GEO Audit is Ready - {keyword}
geoAudit.intro: Your local GEO audit for "{keyword}" in {location} has been completed.
geoAudit.footer: This audit was generated by Serpixa. For questions, contact our support team.

activated.subject: Welcome to {planName} - Your Subscription is Active!
activated.intro: Thank you for subscribing to Serpixa! Your {planName} plan is now active.
activated.footer: Need help? Contact our support team anytime.

renewed.subject: Your {planName} Subscription Has Been Renewed
renewed.intro: Your {planName} subscription has been successfully renewed.
renewed.creditsResetLabel: Your monthly credits have been refreshed!
renewed.footer: Thank you for continuing with Serpixa!

cancelled.subject: Your Subscription Has Been Cancelled
cancelled.immediateMessage: Your subscription has been cancelled immediately and you no longer have access to premium features.
cancelled.endOfPeriodMessage: Your subscription will remain active until {endDate}. After this date, you will lose access to premium features.
cancelled.reactivateMessage: You can reactivate your subscription anytime before the cancellation date.
cancelled.feedbackLabel: We'd love to hear your feedback
cancelled.footer: We're sorry to see you go. If you have any questions, please contact our support team.

refunded.subject: Refund Processed - {amount} {currency}
refunded.intro: A refund has been processed for your subscription.
refunded.timeframeMessage: The refund should appear in your account within 5-10 business days, depending on your payment method.
refunded.footer: If you have any questions about this refund, please contact our support team.

paymentFailed.subject: Payment Failed - Action Required
paymentFailed.intro: We were unable to process your payment for your {planName} subscription.
paymentFailed.warningMessage: To avoid service interruption, please update your payment method.
paymentFailed.deadlineLabel: Please update your payment within the next few days to maintain your subscription.
paymentFailed.footer: If you need assistance, our support team is here to help.

addonPurchased.subject: Credit Pack Purchased - {planName}
addonPurchased.intro: Thank you for your purchase! Your credits have been added to your account.
addonPurchased.footer: Your credits never expire. Happy auditing!

planChanged.subject: Your Plan Has Been Changed to {newPlanName}
planChanged.intro: Your subscription plan has been updated by our team.
planChanged.upgradeMessage: Great news! Your plan has been upgraded.
planChanged.downgradeMessage: Your plan has been changed as requested.
planChanged.prorateNote: Any price difference has been prorated on your next invoice.
planChanged.footer: If you have questions about this change, please contact our support team.

aiContent.subject: Your AI Content is Ready - {keyword}
aiContent.intro: Your SEO-optimized content for keyword "{keyword}" on topic "{topic}" has been successfully generated!
aiContent.footer: This content was generated by Serpixa AI. For questions, contact our support team.
aiContent.errorIntro: We encountered an issue while generating content for keyword "{keyword}" on topic "{topic}".
aiContent.unknownError: An unknown error occurred during content generation.
aiContent.errorFooter: If this issue persists, please contact our support team for assistance.
